abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Telecommunications
            and Information Communications Technology (ICT) Development
            Project is to improve access, quality and use of ICT
            services to achieve socio-economic development in the
            Organization of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS). The project
            is structured along four components: (1) support for legal
            and regulatory reforms, aimed at promoting additional
            competition in the sector and reduce tariffs; (2) universal
            Access or service, aimed at promoting extension of access to
            ICT services to underserved areas through the creation of
            Universal Service Funds (USF) and implementation of
            sub-projects; (3) ICT pilot projects, aimed at improving
            growth and competitiveness in ICT-enabled services through
            the use of broadband and innovative ICT applications; and
            (4) support for the management of the project by Eastern
            Caribbean Telecommunications Authority (ECTEL), the regional
            implementing agency.
